org.mitre.provenance.workflowengine

Class Workflow

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mitre.provenance.workflowengine.Workflow

  • public class Workflow
extends Object
    This object encapsulates a runnable workflow. If you're trying to load some workflow from the database that has already been executed, this isn't what you want. Check PLUSWorkflow instead.

    Workflows contain a bunch of activities, each of which has inputs and outputs.

    This is not a fully-featured workflow engine. There are numerous limitations to the proper functioning of the engine. As of 3/2008, the PLUS MSR plans to later add hooks into more fully-featured workflow engines to make up for the shortcomings and limitations of this code.

    Author:
    DMALLEN

    • Field Detail

      • log

        protected static Logger log

      • ALWAYS_COMPUTE_CONFIDENCE

        public static final boolean ALWAYS_COMPUTE_CONFIDENCE
        Controls whether or not the workflow engine will change confidence values of the data. The workflow engine will *always* change the confidence level of data items whose confidence is not valid (i.e. less than 0 or more than 1). This variable here though controls what the workflow engine will do when the confidence is already valid. If this is set to true, the workflow engine will always change the uncertainty scores according to the specified policy. If it is set to false, the engine will only change the uncertainty scores if they are invalid.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • UNCERTAINTY_POLICY_ALWAYS_1

        public static final int UNCERTAINTY_POLICY_ALWAYS_1
        Uncertainty policy: when uncertainty isn't present for an output, assume 1.0
        See Also:

      • UNCERTAINTY_POLICY_MULTIPLY

        public static final int UNCERTAINTY_POLICY_MULTIPLY

    • Method Detail

      • addPrecomputedObject

        public void addPrecomputedObject(String name,
                                 PLUSObject object)
        Sometimes workflows contain data objects that were not the output of any process. The workflow begins execution with these data objects "precomputed". In order to use one of those, call this function. If you don't add such a precomputed object to the workflow, then the workflow engine will fail to use it as an input to some other activity and your workflow won't run.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the precomputed input. This should match the input name of whatever activity is expecting to consume the object.
        object - the object itself.

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Get the name of the workflow.
        Returns:
        a string representing the workflow's name.

      • setName

        public void setName(String name)
        Set the workflow's name
        Parameters:
        name - the new name to use.

      • alreadyComputed

        public boolean alreadyComputed(String varName)
        Have we already determined what this variable's value is?
        Parameters:
        varName - the name of the variable
        Returns:
        true if we already have a cached value, false otherwise.

      • execute

        public Hashtable<String,PLUSObject> execute(Activity start)
                                     throws Exception
        Execute the workflow. Assume the use of an "Always 1" uncertainty policy, meaning that any data item that does not have a valid uncertainty associated with it will be marked with 1.0. This is equivalent to calling execute(start, UNCERTAINTY_POLICY_GRADUAL_DEGRADE);
        Parameters:
        start - the start node to use.
        Returns:
        the Hashtable containing the outputs of the last activity executed.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • minUncertainty

        public static float minUncertainty(Hashtable<String,PLUSObject> varSet)
        Get the minimum uncertainty from a series of data items.
        Parameters:
        varSet - a hashtable containing string variable names mapped to PLUSObjects
        Returns:
        the minimum uncertainty from all data items in the list. If the actual min is invalid, this will return 0.

      • maxUncertainty

        public static float maxUncertainty(Hashtable<String,PLUSObject> varSet)
        Get the maximum uncertainty from a series of data items.
        Parameters:
        varSet - a hashtable containing string variable names mapped to PLUSObjects
        Returns:
        the maximum uncertainty from all data items in the list. If the actual max is invalid, this will return 1.

      • productUncertainty

        public static float productUncertainty(Hashtable<String,PLUSObject> varSet)
        Get the product of uncertainty values from a series of data items.
        Parameters:
        varSet - a hashtable containing string variable names mapped to PLUSObjects
        Returns:
        the product of all uncertainty from all data items in the list. If the actual product is invalid, this will return 0.

      • validateUncertaintyMeasures

        public Hashtable<String,PLUSObject> validateUncertaintyMeasures(Hashtable<String,PLUSObject> inputs,
                                                                Hashtable<String,PLUSObject> output,
                                                                int POLICY)
        Validate that the uncertainy measures for a particular set of variables is accurate, according to the chosen policy of the execution engine. If the uncertainty measures are not correct, the uncertainty will be modified according to the specified policy.
        Parameters:
        inputs - the input variables to a particular activity.
        output - the output variables to a particular activity
        Returns:
        modified hashtable corresponding to the outputs.

      • execute

        protected Hashtable<String,PLUSObject> execute(Activity start,
                                               int POLICY)
                                        throws Exception
        Execute the workflow.
        Parameters:
        start - the start node to use.
        POLICY - the uncertainty policy to use.
        Returns:
        the Hashtable containing the outputs of the last activity executed.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • computeNeededInputs

        protected Hashtable<String,PLUSObject> computeNeededInputs(Activity a)
                                                    throws Workflow.BackTrackingException
        Calculate which inputs should be used for this particular process. If an input isn't available, we have to defer execution until its precondition is met. Inputs generally come from two different places; either the last value passed as part of the transition, or something from the cache, which was computed earlier.
        Parameters:
        a - the Activity you are about to execute.
        Returns:
        a Hashtable containing variable names mapped onto PLUSObject's that are usable as inputs to this particular activity.
        Throws:
        Workflow.BackTrackingException - if some needed input is not available or has not yet been created. If this happens, then Activity a should not be executed.

      • cacheVariables

        public void cacheVariables(Hashtable<String,PLUSObject> vars)
        Store a set of particular variables in the cache for later use.
        Parameters:
        vars - a hash mapping variable names onto PLUSObjects that are their values.
